description.narrative: Det långsiktiga målet för GOLD är att öka de ekonomiska möjligheterna för medborgare i Bosnien och Hercegovina. Projektet avser att öka illväxtorienterade ekonomiska aktiviteter i de utvalda områdena i landet under de fem år projektet beräknas löpa.

The long-term goal of GOLD is to expand economic opportunity for citizens in BiH. The purpose of the Project is to increase the level of growth-oriented economic activity in selected localities in BiH during the estimated five-year life of the project.

The goal of the Growth-Oriented Local Development Program (GOLD) is to increase economic opportunities for BiH citizens. The purpose of the Program is to increase level of growth-oriented economic activity in selected localities.

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: Because no external valuation was conducted, both Sida and USAID have to draw conclusions about the results and impacts of GOLD based on the reporting from Deloitte who was the implementing partner on achievements and indicator values. This combined with issues in Deloitte's M&E quality poses a problem in some cases since the isolated impact of GOLD cannot be established. Although there was some underperformance on the jobs target, the project still contributed to over 2400 new full-time jobs being registered in the organisations/businesses that the project worked with. Unexpectedly, 55 % of these new jobs were held by women which is a positive result considering the low labour market participation rate for women. Considering the overall low investment rates in the country, the project quite unexpectedly outperformed the set targets for increase in foreign and domestic investments in the supported enterprises. This increase in investments also had a positive effect on jobs numbers and sales and exports. There were also good results in improving the legislative framework for economic growth. The project supported a new Law on Public-Private-Partnerships on cantonal level in Zenica Doboj Canton. As a result, the procedures and regulations for PPP:s are now streamlined and more PPP projects are enabled. The project also supported new adult education laws in three cantons, which has made adult education more available. In addition, the project undertook efforts to make systemic changes to the way in which public, private and education sectors interacted in order to allocate resources to train the next generation of workers. The creation of Vocational Educational Councils in a number of municipalities is one of the impacts of the project that will last beyond its end. These efforts combined will enable people, especially unemployed adults and young people still in education, to develop relevant skills and become more employable. Although the project did produce results, there were problems in the implementation approach. The development of the project and its set-up was not satisfactory to the donors. A more participatory approach should have been used. This contributed to the decision to close the project prematurely as relationships with local institutions were developing in the wrong direction.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
